name: Winery Huszar Pinceszet
description:
We camped close by at a random dirtroad when the friendly owner Huszar came by and invited us to stay at his property. He took us there and we were surprised to find ourselfes on a beautiful winery property. He and his friend were super friendly and opened a bottle of wine immediately. He doesn't want money from you for staying at his place but we bought 2 bottles of his wine, ca. 1500 Forinth each. 

Beautiful place with grassy field to stay at
little playground for kids
free to stay 
winetasting possible.
german and english and hungarian

name: Camping on island of Dunaújváros
description: Small grassland directly on the Donau river, near a ferry crossing the river. Big rigs with low ground clearance may have difficulties to enter the place.

name: Nationalpark Kiskunság near Fülöpháza
description: Parking near ranger training centre. Good starting point for hikes in the park and to the sanddunes. At night some noise from the road (100 meters away).

name: Bugac camping (Bugac Puszta)
description: Camping/resaurant Karikás Csarda , close to Bugac pusta. nearby sheperd museum and horseride show (1900 hf pp)  Camping cost 1500 hf pp including electric, shower and wifi from restaurant.

name: Szeged, parking near cementry
description: Quiet parking near cementry in residencial area.

name: River Beli Drimi near the town Xrxe
description: parking between two restaurants near the bridge over the river Beli Drimi. You can pitch a tent on the lawn near the river in front of it. Big rigs must manouver with the turns going down from the bridge.

name: Haller Camping
description: Super busy but central city camping if you want to see budapest. Very very full during high season but has all services and clean enough. Free laundry, wifi.

name: Parking under the Dome of Esztergom
description: Big parking lot right under the huge Dome. Campers pay 1000 HUF or €4,-. You may stay overnight and you can get water. Toilets €0,50.

name: Donau riverside near Adony
description: Small grassland on the Donau river side near a ferry crossing. The ferry stops after 8.00 PM. Big rigs might have a problem to enter the field if they have little groud clearance.

name: Carina Campsite
description: Well established campground. Decent showers with hot water. One person and motorcycle cost 7.2 euro.

name: Wild Camping Stahlroth
description: Nice spot in the forest. 4x4 might be necessary after heavy rainfall.

name: Blue Flamingo
description:
Small site in the outskirts of Budapest.
We arrived in August and we're lucky to get a pitch. 
Has a nice big pool which was a bonus as it was hot.
Very friendly and welcoming owners.
Showers etc are dated but clean and hot

name: Guest House
description:
after driving on 37 degree heat all day we decided to stop somewhere rather than start looking for camping... and what delight!  swimming pool! 

this was clearly a hunting lodge back in its heyday...

nice en suite rooms 
kitchen to cook your own meal (i suggest asking first as I think normally it is used for banquets) 

8000 florin for two (Approx 27euro )

name: Robo-go (motorbike shop & mechanic)
description:
arrived as opening (9am) and they cracked on straight a way.

oil and filter change - new chain - small fairing fix - total 48,000 florins

name: Borozo
description: In the middle of a small wineyard. A cosy campground. Away from all the hectic of tourism. The owner is friendly and helpfull. Basic facilities but everything you need is here. You welcome to drink a wine on the terras or stube.

name: Retox Hardcore Party Hostel
description: WARNING: You will be leaving this place with the worst hangover of your life! One of the best Party hostels in the world and a grate experience but not for the faint of hatred. Also not convenient to go to with a large vehicle. If you have something large contact them ahead of time and they will help you out.

name: Arena Camping
description: Perfect camping except the noise of the trains passing 5 meters above your heads and the planes taking off every 30 seconds from 4 AM!!! Impossible for us to stay there a second night...

name: Wild camping close to a lake
description: If you need a quick campsite when all official camp sites around Balaton Lake are full, you can pitch your tent or park your camper here for a night.

name: Serbia-Hungary border - vignette info
description:
There are many little booth selling the vignette at the border. Category D1 (car/small van) is 2975 HUF (~10 EUR).  

It is sold at the official price if you have Hungarian currency already. If paying with credit card it will cost 14 EUR. If changing EUR they will also use this terrible exchange rate.

Alternatively, there is a petrol station 1 km after the border (still on the highway) selling the vignette. There you can pay with the credit card at normal price and they even have an ATM. If using the ATM watch out in which currency you want to be debited, if you let them debit you in EUR it is also a very bad exchange rate.

name: Quiet Campsite at the end of town
description: Nice campground with lots of grassy areas but quite new so trees are small, they don't provide much shade. Across the road there is a spa and swimming pools with slides too. Both hot and cold water, many pools.

name: Fish Otter Park
description:
Vidrapark
 http://stvsz.com/csaladbarat-zold-folyoso/petesmalmi-vidrapark/
A very nice Place to See Fish Otter

name: Hortobagyi National Park
description:
hidden little spot behind some trees and  bushes close to Hortobagyi National Park Info Center (Hungarian Puszta). if your car is small enough you can even fit it right at the river shore, but 

a few meters up is also nice and plenty more space. there is a farm round the corner but no one seemed to mind us camping here. the main parking area of the national park visitor center is also an option.

name: AVE NATURA Camping
description:
5 Km from the city of Budapest a very nice place between trees. Quiet, clean and equipped with every comfort. The city center is easily accessible by bus.
Very friendly and welcoming owners.

name: Camping Mindszent
description: Nice small camping with dutch owner (günter) Washing machine! Swimmingpool.

name: Nyirfas Camping
description: ACSI listing. Small, family run, clean, comfortable & well stocked kitchen for camper use. Pool, fishing and working animal farm next door. Free WIFI.  +36 93 / 319-821 or +36 30 / 354-4646

name: Sitke Field
description: Beside a Field and Forest, Trains and Street are near. 4x4 is an advantage.

name: Magyarroute 66
description: This is a Dutch family owned pension with a nice wooded, peaceful campsite for 8 euro per person. The campsite has a fire pit, toilets and hot showers. There is a grill house, a large swimming pool, and a bar from an old wine cellar.  It's best for tent camping but there is some room for small rigs or vans. The owner Leen is a motorcycle enthusiast and a really nice guy. He also speaks many languages. There is a little market around the corner, places to eat in town or you can get continental breakfast at his place for 5 euro. There are also many rooms available for about 40 euro. His property is beautiful, with many animals, donkeys, horses, sheep, bunnies.. We stayed on a weekend and it was lovely, there was a cookout at the grill house and a Hungarian clarinet player, everyone dancing and enjoying themselves.

name: Motel 84
description: Motel in American style (small 'houses' next to each other). The room was clean, quiet area, next to the road. The lady gave us a little discount, 22 euros for two people, usual price was 25. Parking in front of the room.

name: No name road into forest
description: Turn off main road into white gravel road ( no name or sign) then reverse into a sheltered spot beside a track that goes ? into the forest. About 50 mtrs from main road but can be seen for a second or two in both directions until dark.Not the the most picturesque but a wild camp, good luck!

name: HAMEBA Camp
description: Small but familiar camp just at the Balaton Lake. 6 places for caravans, more for tents, few bungalows to rent. Price for one place 16€ per day + 7€ person + 2€ electricity + 1,5€ tax. Everything clean, bring your own toilet paper...

name: Spot near Budapest
description: Pretty good spot for one night if you want to spend night near Budapest.

name: river camping
description: River with Sandy Beach, nice place. not for big rigs. Four wheel drive not necessary but recommended

name: Border Serbia - Hungary at Backi Brag
description:
Exiting Serbia into Hungary. Very mellow border. On a Monday in August, only 2 cars ahead of us at the border. Essentially, no wait. (US citizens with a US registered truck). We were told and read online that the main border at Tomba can have a 4 hour wait in summer - in either direction. Weekends are the worst. So, this border was a great option.
Entering Hungary, you need a vignette to drive on the motorways. We bought ours online - with a small service fee - at http://www.hungary-vignette.eu/. Online we paid €11.91 for a 10-day vignette.

name: Picnic spot in a Park near Baja
description: We found this place on Park4Night (which you should get for overlanding in Europe if you don’t have it yet!) This is a site with picnic tables, campfire rings, and a shelter by a tributary right off of the Danube. No toilets. Easy access off of the main road. When we were here in August, locals were camping here too. Red deer were in rut and making noises - including butting antlers - all night. Really cool. Peaceful spot. Free. There is another large picnic area down the gravel track closer to the Danube.

name: Camping familia
description: Nice looking campsite under the trees. Facilities all there and clean. Owners somewhat old-fashioned in there behaviour, but fine. 30min walk to city centre or 10 min by bus. Paid 5000 in high season, camper + two persons.

name: Oazis-Tanya
description:
Nice campsite with a lot of space on a huge grassy area, a lot of privacy. Clean facilities. Restaurant only in high season. They have a little pool and also a nice playground. It's the most quiet place we've been so far. The owners are dutch and speak german and english and you get a welcome drink. 
The campsite is located near Kiskunhalas in the middle of the 'puszta'. There are some small hiking trails, but besides there's not much to do. If you're looking for some peaceful and quiet days, this is your place. (We don't know what's the deal with wifi here, there seem to be certain times when it's available..)

name: Motel 84
description:
Very nice motel, clean room, hot shower.
Nice staff, we payed 25€ for double room.
In yard is barbecue, so you can prepare your stakes or sausages if you bring some wood..
Address is: Soproni út 26. Tompaládony, Vas, Hungary 9662.

name: G&n
description: Lawn with some trees. Firepits and a playground. Sanitary is quit old but heated and working.

name: Miskolctapolca quiet overnighter
description: This is a very quiet overnighter, stayed here for 2 nights. If you have a large rig (no room for long buses)  please park it on the dirt/grass patch at the back. If you have your own Sim card there is a strong signal 4G. Restaurants are nearby and best of all the Cave Bath is only a 5min walk.

name: Hill Top View
description: Quiet place opon a hill next to a field. Morning Sun. Nobody there. Beautiful view. Good for a night.

name: Drinking Water in a small village
description: A blue hydrant in the middle of the village spends drinking water

name: Balaton Part
description:
Few campervans overnighting here. Gravel parking area behind public toilets. 
didn't spend the night here but looks good if one has a vehicle setup to sleep in. Doesn't look like a place one would pitch a tent.

name: Dieters camping
description: Nice little campsite with lovely german speaking owner. Sanitary is very clean. Little pool available. Restaurant and supermarket nearby.

name: Bikercamp
description:
Camp ground in Center Budapest at 1 km from the river
Nice and small place ideal for bikers and ciclists.

name: Wild Camp with bathing spot
description: Very nice place under trees directly at the river. It seems to be owned be someone but it is for free and you can stay overnight. You can park your car or pitch up your tent. There is a small Café with very friendly staff, they have beer and coffee. They have two dixie toilets too, very clean! You can swim in the river but it is very muddy so the water is not clear, still refreshing though. We really liked it here!

name: Halbolt-Szamos Ungarian Restaurant
description: We had lunch here: very tasty, very large portions and cheap (around 3-4€ for a dish). Highly recommended!

name: Land Rover Repairs
description:
Specializing in Land Rover. Large and tidy workshop, lots of experience with Defenders and Discos. Located behind industrial park, not seen from road - To enter, across from door/window shop, go thru gate barrier and get directions from guard house (quick left, follow curve right, go to end and on right). 

If leaving the car, there's a bus stop at gate (161 and 168E), bus goes to city metro Red #2. 

Lipot is the mechanic, Aniko his wife writes in English.  WhattsApp +36-20-932-5737

name: At the old Tisza river bend
description: A lovely recreational spot at the old Tisza river bend attracting fisher during day time. Small pub nearby. We asked whether we could stay here over night. No problem.

name: If you had not too much Tokaj wine ...
description: ... then drive to the bend in the Tisza river. Fisher durig day time, mosquitos during night time. Quiet!

name: Vekeri Camping
description: Large campsite with a lot of shade. Right next to a bigger road

name: Baja Camping and youth hostel
description: Decent place and cheap! we paid $9eur for 2 people, 2 motorcycles and 1 tent. Some shade, power and water at half the spots & right on the river. there is a little bar and the old town is really nice & just across the bridge. wifi works around the camp, toilets/showers are nice and clean + dishwashing area, some picnick tables and a volley court. Don't misunderstand, this is "city camping" but quiet and nice.

name: Öko-Park Panzió-Kemping
description:
Small campsite in the small village  of Szarvaskö, in the hills just North of the city of Eger. Approx. 25 level pitches available, plus a small terrace for tents. There’s an on-site restaurant/pension/sauna, where traditional meals and breakfast are available. The friendly owners speak some German and English.
Really big camper vans may not be able to cross the bridge over the stream alongside the campsite, especially not when the adjacent parking is full.

name: Pool/Water Park Parking
description: Just spent 7 hours at the Serbian border and hate everyone? This is the perfect solution. Fantastic pool and waterpark, both inside and outside pools, huge water slides and things for little ones. Three temperatures of pools and spas and saunas. Also great showers and lockers, family style locker room. 3.50 euros for two hours without the waterpark. Large parking lots on either side of the pool with some shade. Overnight no problem.

name: Camping next thermal bath
description:
Simple campground with clean old facilities. Next to it there is a nice thermal bath with 100% thermal water not blended, which is quite special.
Costs around 6€ for a camper and two persons for one night. The bath additional 2600huf.

name: Castrum camping Keszthely
description: Great site close to the lake and town centre. 25m swimming pool is nice and facilities great too. Washing machine too and pitches (of varying sizes) separated by hedges. Good spot for a few days. Excellent restaurant at the site too! 22.400Ft for 4 adults for 2 nights. Not bad.

name: Aszalós Hunting Grounds
description: An established wild camp in the forest. Plenty of benches and even a roof over some of them. Fire pit.

name: Bastion Pension
description: Lovely local people, friendly. A twin room for two with private shower and toilet cost us 7500 Ft. They even found someone who gave us private parking in their garage for motorcycle so we don't have to leave it on the street. Available public kitchen facilities.

name: Commercial center Auchan
description: Large free parking of commercial center. The place is lit at night and there is security cameras and gasoline station OMV near to parking.

name: Art Hostel Budapest
description: Art Hostel Budapest is a quite hostel in the old town of Buda, quite cosy, small and familiar.

name: Tisaluc
description: Starting end of August, you will prob. be alone on this site. Really nice, basic but by lake, make fire, hot water etc. Very friendly people running it.

name: Ifiszallo youth hostel camping
description:
Many rooms to check in and big space by the river fo camping @10 euro/2900 Huf. Averge wifi around site but no kitchen.  
Parking is free. 
Nearby restaurant serves nice food.

name: ifiszallo
description: Hostel with camping ground rate 22  euro n 10 euro respectively.

name: Camping Mako
description: Nice and very green campground near the river. It is very quiet and you can camp or rent small bungalow.

name: Parking Lot for Beach
description:
Free to park and camp overnight, with toilet and cold shower. 600 meters to town, restaurants, and grocery store.
 Pay to enter beach area. Probably very busy in high season. Very nice in september.

name: Ukraine Hungary Border
description:
We crossed the border from Ukraine to Hungary. On the Ukraine side smooth, 1/2 hour, from that the check was 10 minutes. On Hungary side slow. But just moving to the check point. Once there, we were finished in 10 minutes. Quick check. Not sure why we waited for 3 hours in a row of bot so many cars (4 rows were open).
We travel with a dog, and had no problems at the border. They just checked the Pet Passport. (We were traveling in Central Asia for 4 months, and this was the point of return to EU)

name: Only border UA —> HU for rigs above 7,5t. Toll Info.
description:
This is the only border from UA towards HU for rigs above 7,5t!

At another borderpoint(!) after heavy discussions the Hungarians strictly sent us back to UA and gave this info. 
We had to immigrate to UA again and go to this place …

Drive about 1,5km into HU to get your toll issues done at a filling station.

name: Small hotel near the highway 25€ a double
description: It is just 5 minutes from the highway. Rooms are basic but with private bath and clean. In the town you can visit an ancient fortress at a lake. There is a supermarket next to it and plenty of restaurants at the lake. They have a small kitchen with tables and microwave. They have a lot of space for parking (we could park our motorcycles right at the entrance, where they have cameras).

name: Parking lot in the forest
description: There are 5-6 parking place on the left and right side of Szepvolgyi street. The locals use only the last one on the right side. The others are usually empty. Gravelly surface, silent, surrounded by the forest.

name: Hotel Silver
description: Thermal bath, cozy surroundings, Nice meal, excellent service

name: Camping Forras
description: Very nice new campsite runned by dutch owners in their second year, very nice place, extremely beautiful, clean and friendly. Perfect ablution block. Ft. 6000 for 4x4 two people.

name: Kipufogo Klinika
description: Company specialized in exhausts, mufflers and metal work. Gave us a fair price on reparation of our Mitsubishi Pajero exhaust pipe which broke off from the muffler. The owner speaks English and we were able to be helped the next day.

name: Oncsa Guest House
description: Very Cheap Rooms. Clear,Friendly. For Adventure Riders #1

name: Tat
description: Nice bay with a tidy wild camp site at the Danube.

name: Area behind picnic tables
description:
There's a wooden structure for shelter (great for bicyclists too), a couple of picnic tables, and 2 fire pits. We parked behind the small stucture, in a flat area surrounded by Trees.

Beautiful drive through the mountains, especially for motorcycles and twisties. Good cell phone service.

name: Tomaj Camping
description: Organized camping along the bicycle ring route. Restaurant, bar, and lots of cabins too. lots of grass and shade, with private access to lake. Cost 6500huf for 2 with camper (electricity included).

name: Place in the street
description:
Place in the street under the trees. Very calm and nice view on the city. Free
necessity to have the sticker to park here !

name: Parking in the park
description: Free parking for the night in the park. you have to pay for the day from 8 to 18h.

name: Wild camp next to the river
description: Nice grassy clear area right next to the river. Hidden but very easy to get to. Turn off the main road on a narrow track and drive straight. Lots of firewood around.

name: private garden open to travellers
description:
All travellers are welcome to stay in my garden and use the bathroom. There's room for tents and small rigs, 230V hookup with your cable, drinking water, all that.
Please call Viktor on 0036707783736

name: Eger Vinyards
description: On the outskirts of Eger a small parking lot in the middle of the vinyards. Lovely winery with great snacks and good wine just around the corner.

name: Mátai Cemetary
description: As quiet as can be ... tucked away beteuern busy Hortebagy and slow Mátai.

name: Grassy Area next to the lake
description:
Nice quiet grassy area right next to the lake. Space for a few cars and tents. A few fishermen around, they were also camping.
No services, great 4G reception

name: Grassy lot with great view
description:
Big, open, grassy field surrounded by lavender bushes and nature.  Located next to a small cemetery, it's the parking lot for the nearby church.  Explore the nearby ancient church. Good 4G coverage.

My wife said this was one of the best places in Hungary (and we live here). It's so quiet, the lot is flat(ish), and has great views.  Out dog loved running around through the tall grass and trees.

name: Riverside
description:
Coming from the border between Slovakia and Hungary in the direction of Budapest. At the Ipoly River, there is a big flat and grassy place.
Some fisherman around. Very quiet at night and you can also swim or fish in the river. Please keep the place clean

name: Lake Tiszató
description: Camping 50 meters from the Lake Tiszató. There is a hotel near and a sign that says that the parking lot is only for customers. Beside the lake, there is also a established camping.  But we parked our car outside the hotel fence. So we went to the hotel and asked the woman in the reception if it was OK to sleep and stay for one night under the trees far away from the entrance of the hotel. She said' no problem'. So we had a good place to sleep with our rooftent.

name: Water tap
description:
Blue water pump next to car park. Seems good quality, even for drinking. 

Post more water supplies on iOverlander people! 
That’s always the hard thing to find

name: Big parking lot - access to lake
description:
Right next to a campsite, a large parking lot with some trees. The campsite doesn’t mind if you stop here for a night, they do not overlook the parking lot, it doesn’t belong to them.
There is a small gate in the corner of the parking lot where you have access to the lale for a swim. No facilities.

name: Porcelain of Herend
description: Visit the museum and the manufacture of porcelain. Very interesting and very famous around the world. Visit in English or German too. I’m not a big fanatic of porcelain but it worth a visit!! Enjoy

name: Esztergom
description: A nice camp site with pool and restaurant close to the centre. We paid 5200 for a night for 2 persons and roof top tent

name: DG pizzeria e pasta
description:
The best pizza and homemade pasta of all Hungary for sure.
The owner, Mario, imports ingredients directly from italy
Enjoy (especially pizza prosciutto crudo and bufala)

name: Local lake with space to park
description: Local swim spot at a lake, two portapotties when we were here, not secluded but nobody cares here ;) there is a small path into a peninsula which is less visible

name: Westend Open Air Parking
description: Open air parking for 3€/day. Open between 07:00-23:00. Vehicle info: Max long is 5m, max high is: 2.5m.

name: Sekret unser Parkinson arena
description: Abandoned Parking area near the highway. Narrow entrance.  Paved ground. Completely secluded. good for the night before entering Budapest. Full GSM and Internet connection due to GSM Post nearby.

name: Lidl
description: All the generic groceries one might need, standard Lidl shopping.

name: Emmarozs bakery/coffee/lunch
description: Fantastic quality of coffee, bread from their own bakery and beautiful assortment of cakes and lunch. We only went 3 time in 1,5 day :-)

name: Free spot in the park
description:
Relatively quiet, surrounded by nature. Free. Police passed by to say hi, didn’t bother us.

1km from a metro station that brings you directly to the center (M3)

name: Castle and stone waterfall
description:
Beautiful caste with a rare rock formation nearby. Hiking trails all around. Easy and flat space to park right next to the castle.

At the border between Hungary / Slovakia

name: Lakeside
description: A flat spot next to a small lake and few others along the way (more for fishing than swimming in). A few cars passed by, but nobody bothered us. A little noise from a distant road can be heard. To reach the spot, follow a gravel road.

name: Savoyai-kastély előtti park
description: Beside the Danube river, in the Eurovelo 6 bicycle route (Rackevé town). There is a very good grass campground. Most used by fishermen.

name: Small forest close to kelebija border crossing
description: The GPS point is the entrance to a track leading into a smal forest. We drove until a small clearance with an information board. About 500 m. About 200 m from the entrance two tracks turn left, take the second. The information board is on Mapsme. Good for smaller vehicle. A quiet place to stay after or before crossing the border. Houses not close by.

name: Propane /gas filling station
description: Right behind the petrol station. The old guy has an old-timer RV himself, he was very helpful. Doesn’t speak English so your best bet is google translator.

name: Wild Camping Site near the ferry
description: Grassy area at lake bench, close to the ferry. There’s no amenities, just for wait for ferry, or just in case you loose the last one.

name: Dörgicse
description: Huge grassy area, close to the road and the Dörgicse village.

name: Riverside
description: Nice spot near river Donau. Bike track is crossing. Few minutes by walk to the city.

name: Grass parking near the border
description: Wild parking near some plantation, grass area. night very quiet.

name: in to the forest
description: it is place in the forest,  far from city. Road to this spot is the sandy (4x4 car is requaiermant)

name: Baja field
description: small place at the end of the dirty road near a pond. OK for one 2wd van but maybe not big one. really quite, just frog noise at this season.

name: blue fontain
description: blue aqua hydrant on the main road in the beginning of Zomba village

name: Children park at forest.
description: Place to do fire, tables, water tap, WC and some kids game as zip line, etc.

name: Arak Parking
description: We overnight 2 days. During the day it is very visited but it is quiet at night.  Two kilometers from the Jewish quarter. The same to the Parlament.

name: Tihany
description: Drinking water and a good place to stay at night during the off-season

name: Heviz fontain
description: aqua drinking fontain in center of the village.

name: On the wild
description: Few km south Gramat (lot ) flat place near the old socker place ,Quiet

name: szigetköz kemping
description: nice gras flat near onearm of the river donau.great people speakin german,english,spanish.very peaceful,people like to help.my great favorite.

name: Tihany village
description: we slept here one night in out tourist season and no problem. very nice place, quite, 5 min walking to the center. playground for kids.

name: camping nomad aggletek cave or onthe parking
description: great grass place,at the etrane to te cave you can stay for the night.

name: Plum Grove
description:
Very steep road up a small hill. Been here in the beginning of august. Some leftover plums for us. :) Gate is not locked and there is no sign that it is a private property. 

Very calm with a nice view!

name: Budapest parking
description:
good parking for visit Budapest. 
you can stay here all time you need, ok for sleep. no commodity, no electricity, camera security and a guardian on the journey. 
4800 forint ( 12,65€) for 46h.
lot of space, 15 min walking to Széchenyi bath and 30 min to basilica Saint Étienne. 
it's not beautiful but it does the job. quiet at night.

name: Koppány Pines
description: Established campsite. Camping pitches, preset bell tents, guesthouse. Water, electric, waste disposal. Showers toilets. Bar and food available on request. Breakfast available. Nice location quiet.

name: drinking Water
description:
there is a drinking water Pump
not for filling tank, just drinking

name: wild camp for the night
description: not much but if you looking for fast place this doo the jon.

name: parking right on Balaton lake
description: 2 restaurants around and quiet spot. just a train paint by once in a while. had a great night at the bar

name: Bertalangarten
description: Family garden. We paid €13/night incl water/electra so if you need a refill for all your stuff, this is a great spot. Close to the lake and lots of bars/restaurants.

name: Sarberki Horgaszto
description: Good price for tent campground with a few lakes for fishing. Close to the city Lenti and Slovenia border. You can buy a food and beer here. There is playground for kids

name: Napsugar Büfé
description:
Definitly the best büfé in Hungary with fresh delicious food and a super nice location directly at Lake Balaton. 
If you want to have an incredible breakfast/lunch/dinner in a local restaurant with the most friendly service, this the place to go. They offer a wide selection of homemade typical Hungarian specialities for low  prices, also good choice of wines! The owners are extremely friendly and hospitable (Zoli bácsi and his wife Tündi) and they even speak English and German. If you are nearby, this place is  definitely worth a stop, even just for a good cold beer at the nice terrace or a coffee! We highly recommend this place.

name: Campsite
description:
Wonderful tiny campsite in the hungarian Puszta. Remote location which can be reached on sandy dirt road. I detected no direction signs. Dutch owner speaks several languages.

Phone: +36-(0)183-352741

name: wild camping Danube
description: Small beach in the river with many trees. The site is hiden but very close to a bike path. There is some noise of trains and boats.

name: Rezi Gelencser Pince
description: I offer you as an international traveller. The grassy area next to my own cellar for wild camping. You can also pitch a tent or camp in a camper behind the old wine cellar on the top of the Apple Hill. There is no water in the area, but there is a public well 1,5 km from the village of Rezi, next to the cemetery. Panoramic view from the cellar towards Hévíz and the Keszthely mountains, the cellar area is not fenced. The potty toilet can be used.

name: spot for tent
description:
LIMITED VEHICLE ACCESS
perfect little spot to pitch your tent. the street is quite (with dead end and only few houses) and there are bushes to hide behind on a field with beautiful fruit trees. on the other side you are overlooking fields of grain.

name: countrycamp-jb.com
description: A campsite to remember, really top for bikes and campers. Great style camp in a beautiful small village. Owners great come from Belgium. You can also rent a camper and also stay with the tent. They are very positive and the campsite has just opened.

name: Tördemici kilátó
description: Stayed here for two nights, in Hungary, wild camping is legal (check local rules). Lovely view of St George Hill and some little towns. There's three picnic tables and space for a small tent.

name: Fisher place
description:
Picnic place. Toilets, picnic tables and flat area.
Next to the road but quiet at night.
Some fishers during the day, friendly.

name: Near field
description: Nice flat place near to fields. Near to the road but quiet at night.

name: Dog beach
description: Flat grass area near to the dog beach. You can swim with dogs here. Nice place. Be careful - music on Saturday night.

name: Kávé Pont (24H)
description: Good working WiFi. Self-service. Vending machines for coffee and other snacks. There's no receptionist, but a phone number to call in case of faults. also the Hungarian emergency services are written out for clients. Recommended if you're lost and do not have mobile data. It is next to the regional bus station and train station.

name: Varoserdó
description: Here is one possibility to get drink water.

name: VPT-caravan camper parking
description: Little caravan park with room for 6 cars/caravans. It is owned by the Hymer camper dealership next door. Gate opens with a code, booking is done through their website (vpt-camp.hu). Although the location isn't very scenic, they've tried to make it look cozy. Very clean and well maintained. Situated on a busy road, but traffic quiets down after 20:00.

name: near Donau River
description: Nice flat spot. It's the first place next to the border. Nobody here and you can swim in the river. You don't need 4x4. Maybe not for big rigs.

name: Eger Patak
description:
Perfect spot at the edge of Szarvasko village. There is a park bench, space for a few tents (no direct road access) and a built up fire circle ( please observe any fire restrictions in place while staying in Hungary). As is with most Hungarian towns, water is easily found from nearby wells. I recommend looking on alltrais for them.
There is a great specialty coffee 'shop' called Makako not far, ideal for the morning [opening at 9am].

name: Camping Napfeny (Sunshine)
description:
Super cute little campground for tents, cars, vans. Super friendly staff/owners.
Hot showers, clean toilets, wifi, electricity.
It was very quitet. We ended up here as the 3 campings we visited at Balaton Lake were fully booked.

name: Derítö-tó Fisherman Village
description: This is a fishing village on a lake where technically there is no camping but the staff are super friendly and allow for it. Place is magical in itself. There are fisherman's huts around the lake. Staff fluent in English. Turn of the main road towards the lake. Take immediate left and first right. Gate is automatic but please report to the camps office far right corner.

name: Lake overlooking
description:
A wide space that is flat overlooking the lake and the town below. The road to this spot is fairly easy during a dry day for a 4x4.

Getting there is accessible really not a problem but for a motor home that is higher than 2.3 night it would be very challenging due to the over grown branches on the road. Also it is very narrow and there are points where it is challenging to turn.

name: River side with shore
description:
Ver secluded space an take 1 or 2 cars
4x4 is preferred ( judge in the space on your own ) 

Over grown weed and branches from above.

name: Danube Beach
description:
Nice spot at a very nice beach next to the Danube.
Some trees for shadow, under two of them is a flat place for 1-2 tents or a car. 
Some locals here during the day, still only few garbage.

name: Ipokykapu Kemping.
description:
Fairly new campground on the Danube.  Very nice individual grass pitches with power.  Check in is not allowed until 2pm (?).  Wifi, bathrooms, kitchen complete with  fridges, stoves and sinks for washing up.  Small washing machine available on request (costs extra).  3 large clothes lines.  4G cell reception.  Owner did not speak much English and she wants to see your passport (not a copy!).  Shops and restaurants nearby as well as a ferry across the river. There's free wifi near the dock that's quite fast too.  

The price list attached in photos.  We paid about $23 USD per night: 2 adults, one motorhome with power.

name: RV parking
description: A midsize parking lot that also caters to motorhomes.  Upon arrival call the number on the left side of the gate (bottom number worked for us).  He will open the hate and  give you the code to open the gate to walk out.  You leave the money in a mail box on the little building inside.  The price was 15 euros for 24 hrs.  There is power (for 5 vehicles), fresh water, WiFi, cassette dumping and grey water dump too.  No bathroom so you must have your own.  Great location near the city.  Pretty quiet too.  You also need to call to get out.  Note: there is an app called "ParkL* that is supposed to do the same but we couldn't get it to work.

name: Forest Service camp site
description: One small shelter, tables, fire places, free spaces for tents. Easy access even with car.

name: Forest setvice campsite
description: 2x Table + Bench with fireplace, right next to the main road. Can be reached with car or motorbike.

name: Forest service campsite
description:
Table + bench with fireplace.
Near the main road, accessible by car or motorbike.

name: Forest service campsite
description:
Few tables with bench and fireplace.
Near the main road, accessible by car or motorbike. Ideal for small group wildcamp.

name: Forest service campsite
description:
3x Table + bench with fireplace.
Near the main road via a small bridge. Accessible by car or motorbike, can be parked 50m away from the campsite.

name: Határrét campsite
description:
Table + few benches with fireplace.
Near the main road, accessible by motorbike.
Low ground clearance cars might have an issue to reach it. Same spot is available 50m away!

name: Camping Gartnerhof
description: Lot's of shady spots, clean facilities, friendly owners. £18 2 pax plus motorcycle. Little noisy but ok for a night.

name: Vadasa Camping es Fahazak
description: Excellent campground, spacious, plenty of shade and good facilities. Close to restaurants and bars. €17 tent 2 pax plus motorcycle.

name: Forest service campsite (No vehicle access)
description:
Shelter + fireplace + several tables.
Acces for vehicles is prohibited directly from the main road.

name: Shelter near the lake
description: Shelter with tables close to the lake. Easy access.

name: Lake campsite
description: Beach and campsite at a lake. During sumertime season operates as on official beach with reastaurant.

name: Watertap Noszlop
description: Watertap. Strong pressure. You can connect hose.

name: next to Jimmys Restaurant
description:
parking near a Sport field and Jimmys Restaurant
you can eat good and low price

name: Border control HU/RO
description: Schengen Zone border control. A few kilometres after on the Romanian side is a railway crossing with a Stop sign, which is virtually invisible in the darkness and an RO border police waiting if you don’t stop or stop too late. Railway is active so be really careful.

name: Near Serbian border, Nandafalva Hindu Temple
description: 20 minutes from the Serbian border. Grassy meadow Car park belonging to the Hindu Temple opposite. Overnight camping allowed by donation. Quiet. Flat. We understand there is a toilet in the temple's yard.

name: Steigervald Tanya
description: Riding stables in the Puszta, carriage rides, traditional restaurant. On the edge of the Puzta you can camp with a wonderful view. Apparently the barrier is closed in the evening and an old couple lives in the adjoining building and lets you in. 5000 Huf 2 for camper with 2 people. Electricity and hot showers available.

name: next to river
description: Free parking space on grass on the banks of the Danube at the former ferry pier. Restaurants all around. It was very quiet in September.

name: kimis camp
description: small, inexpensive campsite 20 km from Lake Balaton. Marianne and Rainer Nowack are friendly hosts and are happy when the guests are doing well. In winter you should ask  kimis-camp-info@gmx.net if they are open. This year, 2021, they close in winter .

name: River Duna
description: Nice place next to river Duna.         .

name: Castle Bátorkő
description: 0Nice place near Castle Bátorkő.           .

name: Lake Velencei
description: Nice campsite, next to the lake Velencei. Near to Pákozd and Sukoro. the road takes you from Velence.

name: Niagara Car Wash
description: One of the best car wash for 4 wheels drive vehicles or motorhomes in Budapest. Guys can lift up your car to wash the button and have high enough building to clean your vehicle outside and inside over 2m tall. Have a waiting room to monitor the cleaning process on a screen.

name: On the Border
description: Quiet dead end meadow parking lot in front of the pedestrian border crossing within walking distance to the children's thermal baths

name: Camping Györ
description: Small campside at a small lake. Nice owner, approx 1.5km to town. Grassy campground. Approx 20 places. Showers and toilets are a bit outdated but ok.

name: quiet nice parking area
description:
officially parking area for heritage center in nature, information center nearby, I asked for campsite, "of course, no problem"
it's a quiet big place

name: shelter with tables on the EV6
description:
Wooden shelter with a roof and 3 picnic tables. 
It is brand new. Right next to eurovelo 6. 
Ideal for eating in the dry when it rains. 100m before there is a water reservoir (or even a house to fill water bottles)

name: passzio panzio
description: hotel with inside gate parking for motorcycle

name: Onkiszolgalo Mosoda
description:
Large parking lot in front.  
Big capacity.  
1700 HUF for 11 kg
Payment by card possible

name: Free campspot next to river / EuroVelo 6
description: This spot is marked as „Vizitúra sátorhely / Free campsite“ on Google and seems to belong to the local community. Large grassy field, some trees, benches and tables. A bistrot is close by. We stayed with a tent & bicycles here, seems to be completely fine for a night. No facilities.

name: Rest & possibly camp by the river (EuroVelo 6)
description: Large grassy spot with tables, fire place, swings directly by the river. Didn’t camp here, but should be feasible for 1 night. No facilities.

name: Dömsöd Strand-Kemping
description: Campsite with large grassy area to pitch tents. Directly at the beach. They also rent small huts. Basic, clean showers. Camper vans can’t drive onto the property, but we saw one van parked in front (maybe possible to have a shower only?!). Small bar & restaurant. We paid 4.000 Forint (2 persons, 1 tent).

name: picnic spot
description:
Camping spot with picnic tables and fire rings, near the road and the river. Only accessible by foot. Space for 3-4 tents and trees for hammocks.
We didn't have problem camping there but we saw some people pass through, so not the most private spot and we heard noises from the road. 
Had a great time, enjoy !

name: Tulipan Camping
description: Nice place. friendly owner. About 15 minutes walk from the old town of Eger.

name: Retro Bike Workshop
description:
Excellent bike service. Possible to contact them on Facebook and ask for appointment. 
http://www.retrobringa.hu/

name: Hercegkut Petrol Station
description:
Good price at this petrol station, they have diesel & take Visa. (1,42€/l May, 2023)
It’s near a village with a good little co-op.

name: Tisza Beach Camping
description: Rustikal campground at the river not far from the city of Szeged.

name: several spots
description: between the castle and these coordinates there are several spots beside the gravel road. quits spots.

name: Camping Vasarosnamèny
description: There is an amusementpark, where you can park over night. On weekend it is busy and during the week it can be loud when groups are camping. There are four restaurants nearby. At a river is a beach.

name: Spot for wild camping
description: Accessible on a gravel road, even by passenger car or road motorcycle

name: Balatonbereny
description: Small area ( 2 rig max ) in the backyard of a restaurant ( Tekergo) 400 ft / night toilet and shower

name: Csörgő Vendégházak
description: Beautiful camp site for tent / bicycle travellers. Scenic, quiet surrounding, simple facilities (toilet, shower, little kitchen, electricity). Not particularly suitable for vans/cars.

name: Water tap after slovakian border
description: Blue water tap right at the street with almost fresh water, don’t know if it’s really drinkable but for cooking and washing it will be fine

name: camp ground
description: a quiet place by the fishing lake, during the fishing season you will not be alone here

name: Tanya Riaad camping
description: Lovely small campsite, very rural, surrounded by fields. Run by a couple of older German guys, very relaxed and simple place. 2 nice bathrooms, kitchen area and undercover eating area, small pool as well. Access is via a sandy track/road

name: Hidden spot behind ruin in the vineyards
description:
good spot for tent or camper, hidden from the path behind a little ruin, much shade in the morning, some people came by but didn’t saw me. 
Pls take your trash with you :)

name: Öko Kemping & Glamping Tiszadada
description: Great little camping spot. Has a small area for tents and campers. Near the Tisa river surrounded by fields on the edge of the village. nice facilities and very quiet.

name: Szeged forest
description: We spent here two nights. A fantastic place to get to the town for sightseeing, to the park and also to the city beach. No services are offered here. Please take your garbage to the big bins at the street. Sometimes are fishermen here as well. But nobody was complaining about our stay.

name: flat field by lake
description: Great, large field with toilets, kids play area, table. No entry to the lake unfortunately. Right on the lake cycle trail/EV14. There is charging in the toilet if you are happy leaving your electronics in there. Running water in the toilets but the sinks are small for filling bottles. 2 other tents and a caravan here the same night as us.

name: by the ferry slip
description:
Bike packers
Right on the EV6, we slept under the gazebo in the large flat field. Quiet, undisturbed night. There's bins and benches for cooking at the ferry slip. There's also a gravel track here where a van spent the night. No water, we found a tap in the village. Lots of restaurants but few shops.

name: Roverland KFT
description: Specialist for Land Rovers. Really helpful guys. They went out of their way to help us first with front dampers and then with a major engine problem. Very knowledgeable and supportive. Even worked beyond normal hours to help us. Thanks  https://roverlandkft.hu/

name: Szélmalom Vendéglö
description: Very nice restaurant with delicious Hungarian food. Friendly English-speaking owner and staff. Fair prices. Attention: the portions are huge:-)

name: Termal Kemping
description:
On one hand it is a normal campsite.
On the other hand, it is small, clean, nearly 90% locals. The rest from Romania, Poland...
Quiet, relaxed athmosphere. 9000ft/per night/van/2persons.
Direct, included entry to thermal bath, Sauna, pools...!!! 
No restaurant at the place, but at the swimming pool. 
20min. to City Center.

name: Vadviz Kemping
description:
Small campsite, mainly for canoeing, most probably crowded at the weekends. Facilities are basic, but working and clean.
A lot of open space, directly at a side arm of the river. Swimming is possible!
Many open fire places. 
...and a little bar/restaurant (not open every day?!)
10.000ft/2persons/van/place

name: Danubio
description: Nice place to stay,  in front of the River but there is not beach. There is a park for dogs and a big green area. You can Get here with 3.30 m high rigs with no problem, but the road its forbidden for >3.5 Ton rigs

name: Gas Station
description:
Possible to find water in the car wash, the guy its kind, but doesnt know to speak english. Use your translator. Im not sure if the water its potable. I put 120 L In my van.

The gas station its 20 m in front of a KFC and 100 m in front of a ALDI supermarket

name: Parking on the island
description: Parking spot on a nice place, works from 9am to 9pm, but you can not sleep here. Big rigs allowed

name: Forest in the middle of industrial zone
description: Quiet place, 20 min to the city center, very big space behind the trees to park, any size of camper can fit here, and there are more than 50 places to park, quiet place in the night, you can hear far far away the sound of the train and the airport

name: kemping
description: Water and chemical bathroom for free, other facilities only in summer

name: Bird-watching Tower
description:
Flat, grassy and clean place next to the bird-watching tower. Not visible from the main street. Nothing going on - we were always alone. Very quiet at night. Good internet reception.  
In spring and autumn, many migratory birds are said to stop here.

name: Baross Gabor Road
description: Fountain next to the main street. Don't know if it's drinkable water. Parking possible.

name: Ferry Tiszalök - Tiszatardos
description: Nostalgic crossing with a beautiful car ferry across the river Tisza. Friendly ferryman.

name: Szinva-forras
description: A lot of good cold, clear spring water and the locals fill their drinking bottles. Parking very possible.

name: Self service laundry - Torvenyhaz u.
description: Very nice and clean self service laundry. 4 washing machines (11kg and 16kg) and 3 tumble dryers (16kg and 25kg). Operation of all machines via a central machine - also in English and German. Payment in cash or by card possible. Washing machine 11kg, 30min, 2400 HUF (including washing powder) and washer-dryer 16kg, 37min, 2400 HUF. Free WiFi.

name: Acsa
description: Grassy and flat spot on a hill next to the road. Beautiful view but without shadow. Quiet. Good internet reception.

name: Ferry Vác - Tahitótfalu
description: Car and passenger ferry across the Danube between Vác and Tahitótfalu. Runs every hour on the hour until 8 p.m. during the season. We paid a total of 3000 HUF for a car and 2 adults. The ferry starts very punctually.

name: Dabube Bank near Komárom
description: Nice spot right on the banks of the Danube. Quiet except for a few fishermen and walkers. Sunny or shady possible. Quick and easy to reach from main road. 4x4 not necessary. Fantastic sunset.

name: Fekete To - Black Lake
description: A really nice place next to the lake side with desk and wildwatch.

name: Super Pop self-service laundry
description:
1500ft (~3,80€) per laundry and again for drying
not busy, free wifi, nice cafe next door
can pay with card or cash
explanations in Hungarian and English

name: Miskolc (free parking)
description: Big free parking. Close to the Thermal Cave, 12 minutes walk. We stayed here for 3 nights without any  problems with our expedition truck. Every night 1-2 different campers also stayed here. There is no water or electricity. There is a busstop that can take you to the city centre (bus nr 20). Tickets available in the bus for 700huf cash. ATM machine 5 min walking along the road to the thermal cave.  Some noise from traffic from the nearby road but not over excessive. At the small part of the parking we had one night some young people having a drink and laugh, but no problems. Good 4g signal.

name: Flow Hostel
description: Nice hostel , safe parking for the motorbike ( free ) , the hostel have kitchen , free coffee, nice ppl . Just in the center city

name: Vignette
description: You can get a vignette at the kiosk at the parking lot after the border

name: Tihany free parking
description:
Free parking near the "plagette fitted out" 700m from here. Good for the day as the other parking lot is 1050 HUF / hour.
Stayed here for 2 nights. Some hikers and bikers parked here as well. Nobody seemed to mind. 
Next to a road, but didnt mind the noise.

name: Falusi Étterem 64
description: When you are on a short or long voyage, do not miss this place. Far enough from Budapest, close to Balaton, border. Incredible good food, very biker friendly. The owner gives permission for a safe campground ( though it’s not an established campsite).
